newsitem.title: USA: Video Lottery wins $45 mln Minnesota contract. [CORRECTED 17:25 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Video Lottery wins $45 mln Minnesota contract. [CORRECTED 17:25 GMT]

text.p: Video Lottery Technologies Inc said Tuesday that its subsidiary, Automated Wagering International Inc, has signed a new five-year contract, worth an estimated $45 million, to continue to provide on-line services for the Minnesota State Lottery. The contract was awarded through competitive bidding.

AWI has been the on-line system services provider for Minnesota during the past seven years. Under the new contract, which begins in August, the company said the Lottery will continue to use the existing central control system and terminals to service more than 1,900 retailers in the state.
Video Lottery and its subsidiaries provide system software, equipment, and related services for on-line lotteries, video lotteries and pari-mutuel systems throughout the world.
